metadata.Description: Funds owned by a state and invested in various financial assets.

entities.Description: New and creative ways of raising funds for projects or initiatives.
Organizations that provide financial support and expertise for development projects in multiple countries.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Foundational energy infrastructure refers to the essential physical structures and systems that support the production, distribution, and consumption of energy.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A concept that aims to ensure a fair and equitable transition to a sustainable energy system, taking into account social, economic, and environmental aspects.
Energy and modernization refers to the process of integrating modern energy systems and technologies into various sectors of society.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.
Green bonds are fixed-income financial instruments that are used to raise capital for projects that have positive environmental or climate benefits.

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds implement innovative financing strategies to support sustainable energy projects.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds provide funds for sustainable energy projects to promote clean and renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds focus on making long-term investments in sustainable energy projects to ensure their viability and impact.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds play a crucial role in investing in the energy transition towards a more sustainable and low-carbon future.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds partner with clean energy companies to accelerate the development and deployment of sustainable energy technologies.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds contribute to climate change mitigation by investing in sustainable energy projects and technologies.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds closely monitor the performance of their investments in sustainable energy projects to ensure optimal returns and impact.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds set targets for investing in renewable energy infrastructure to support the transition to clean and sustainable energy sources.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds

relations.Description: Sovereign wealth funds address energy poverty by investing in sustainable energy projects that provide access to affordable and clean energy for underserved communities.
relations.Subject: sovereign wealth funds
innovative financing
relations.Description: Innovative financing employs green bonds as a financial instrument to raise funds for sustainable energy projects.

relations.Subject: innovative financing
relations.Description: Innovative financing collaborates with development banks to leverage their expertise and resources for financing sustainable energy projects.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

relations.Subject: foundational energy infrastructure
relations.Description: Foundational energy infrastructure implements energy efficiency policies that promote the use of energy-saving technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: foundational energy infrastructure
relations.Description: Foundational energy infrastructure focuses on grid modernization to improve the efficiency and reliability of energy distribution.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices fund renewable energy projects to increase access to clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: green bonds
relations.Description: Green bonds are used to implement the Energy Efficiency Policy, which promotes the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: multilateral development banks
relations.Description: Multilateral development banks implement energy efficiency policies to promote sustainable energy practices.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.
